resources.string: For a converging lens, a light ray that is travelling parallel to the principal axis refracts through the optical centre.
A object is placed between f and 2f for a diverging lens. The image will be located between the lens and f.
Light that travels into the eye passes through several parts to get to the retina. The correct order is Cornea, vitreous humour, lens, pupil.
The proper name for the inability to focus in different planes is Hyperopia。
The proper name for farsightedness is Hyperopia.
Only the wave theory of light offers an explanation for the ability of light to exhibit Interference.
The two characteristics of light can best be explained by the wave theory of light is Reflection and refraction.
Reflection can be observed for transverse waves only.
Sources that produce waves with a constant phase relation are said to be Polarized.
If all parts of a light beam have a constant phase relationship, with the same wavelength and frequency, the light beam is Monochromatic and coherent.
Is a plane mirror like pools of water?
In an image , which your brain perceives even though no light rays pass throught it , is called a virtual image.
Concave mirrors are like convex mirror.
A mirror that curves outward like the back of a spoon is called a convex mirror.
A survivor from a shipwreck sees an image of a fish in the water. To catch it with her spear, she must aim at the image of the fish.
A light ray has an angle of incidence of 34º. The reflected ray will make what 0º with the reflecting surface?
The critical angle for diamond (n = 2.42) submerged in water (n = 1.33) is 17º?
Calculate the index of refraction for an object in which light travels at 1.97 x 108 m/s is 1.52 m/s?
The critical angle of zircon is 31°. The incident angles would result in total internal reflection is 31°.
When a light ray travelling in glass is incident on an air surface, Some of the light may be reflected.
The diffraction pattern produced by a double slit will show greatest separation of maxima when the color of the light source is red.
If the wavelength of the light is decreased, the width of the central maximum in the diffraction pattern will decrease.
Compared to the period of a wave of red light, the period of a wave of blue light is same.
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 3.0X10^(17) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as x-ray.
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 5.0X10^(-10) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as UV.
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 3.0X10^(15) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as UV
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 3.0X10^(-16) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as radio.
The colour of visible light depends on its wavelength.
The colour of visible light depends on its energy.
The colour of visible light depends on its speed.
Compared to the period of red light, the period of violet light is same.
Interference and diffraction can be explained by the wave theory only
Compared to the frequency of red light, the frequency of violet light is same.
Compared to the frequency of violet light, the frequency of red light is greater.
Compared to the frequency of violet light, the frequency of blue light is greater
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 3.0X10^(15) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as UV
Electrons oscillating with a frequency of 3.0X10^(-16) hertz produce electromagnetic waves. These waves would be classified as radio.
The colour of visible light depends on its wavelength.
The colour of visible light depends on its energy.
The colour of visible light depends on its speed.
